identificationModule.briefTitle: Aveir VR Coverage With Evidence Development Post-Approval Study
identificationModule.officialTitle: Aveir Single-Chamber Leadless Pacemaker Coverage With Evidence Development (ACED) Post-Approval Study

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this coverage with evidence development (CED) study is to evaluate complications and long-term health outcomes of the single-chamber Aveir Single-Chamber Leadless Pacemaker device (Aveir VR LP).
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
This is a non-randomized, multi-center study leveraging real-world evidence methods that merge multiple real-world datasets from Abbott and the Center for Medicare Services to compare Aveir VR LP safety and health outcomes to those in patients implanted with single-chamber transvenous pacemakers in a large patient population.

The study will enroll all Medicare patients implanted with the Aveir VR LP and, as the control group, patients implanted with a single-chamber ventricular transvenous pacemaker from any manufacturer.

armGroups.label: Device: Aveir VR Leadless Pacemaker System
armGroups.description: This study will utilize real-world data from patients implanted with the Aveir VR Leadless Pacemaker System. No device intervention is required in this study.
interventionNames: Device: Aveir VR Leadless Pacemaker System

armGroups.label: Device: Single-Chamber Transvenous Pacemaker
armGroups.description: This study will utilize real-world data from patients implanted with a single-chamber transvenous pacemaker as a comparator to the Aveir VR LP system study arm. No device intervention is required in this study.

interventions.name: Aveir VR Leadless Pacemaker System
interventions.description: This study will utilize real-world data from patients implanted with the Aveir VR Leadless Pacemaker System. No device intervention is required in this study.
armGroupLabels: Device: Aveir VR Leadless Pacemaker System

interventions.name: Single-Chamber Transvenous Pacemaker
interventions.description: This study will utilize real-world data from patients implanted with a single-chamber transvenous pacemaker as a comparator to the Aveir VR LP system study arm. No device intervention is required in this study.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Subjects with Acute Device-Related Complications
primaryOutcomes.description: Rate of acute complications in subjects implanted with an Aveir VR LP compared to subjects implanted with a single-chamber ventricular transvenous pacemaker. Acute complications are defined as a peri-procedural, device-related adverse event within 30 days post-implant.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Subjects Alive after 2 Years
primaryOutcomes.description: The 2-year survival rate of subjects implanted with an Aveir VR LP compared with subjects implanted with single-chamber ventricular transvenous pacemaker.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Subjects with Chronic Device-Related Complications
secondaryOutcomes.description: Rate of chronic complications in subjects implanted with Aveir VR LP compared with subjects implanted with a single-chamber ventricular transvenous pacemaker, from 31 days through six months post implant procedure. A chronic complication is defined as a post-procedural, device-related adverse event that requires invasive intervention to resolve.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Subjects with a Device-Related Re-Intervention
secondaryOutcomes.description: Rate of device-related re-intervention in subjects implanted with an Aveir VR LP compared to subjects implanted with a single-chamber ventricular transvenous pacemaker, through 2 years post implant procedure.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
The study cohort will include all Medicare patients with continuous claims data implanted with an Aveir VR leadless pacemaker or a full-system single-chamber ventricular transvenous pacemaker (from any manufacturer) in any US location

Inclusion Criteria:

Medicare beneficiaries implanted with an Aveir VR leadless pacemaker on or after the study start date (i.e., the date of Aveir VR market approval) will be included in the study.

OR

Medicare beneficiaries implanted with a full system (e.g. lead and generator) single-chamber ventricular transvenous pacemaker on or after the study start date

Exclusion Criteria:

None
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: The study cohort will include all Medicare patients with continuous claims data implanted with an Aveir VR leadless pacemaker or a full-system single-chamber ventricular transvenous pacemaker (from any manufacturer) in any US location
